intro: Clematis javanica, commonly known as the Javan clematis, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun. Its stems are woody and can grow up to several meters in length, often twining around supports. The flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
